blurb: You're at Burning Man, with six choices to make before the world goes white. Choose wisely. Or wildly. The dust storm won't care. (Cover: Trish Lamanna)
author: Jim Munroe
name: Black Rock City

newParagraph.text: You can see outside that the dust-storm is just about to break, and the anticipation is delicious.

text.text: You give him the freezie skin. When he puts it away a few fall out -- the wind is picking up.Â
You realize the bag he's got them in is overflowing, and after you help him retrieve the strays you tie up the bag and take it.
"Let me get rid of this for you," you say.
"Oh. Thanks!" he says, and he smiles. You feel like you've melted the freezie guy with your small gesture.
You nod and as he bikes away you notice his belt is made of freezie skins. You watch him go until the dust storm sweeps in and the world does a white out.

newParagraph.text: Some deepsea synth reverberates through the vehicle.
"We got some moonshine whiskey today, cut with a bit of guava," he says.
He plucks a book from behind him. "Smell this," he says, fanning through the pages near your nose. "That's some fine aged literary must."

text.text: Mr. Bamford is staring out intoÂ

newParagraph.text: "Hi Derek," you say. You shake hands, formally.

text.text: away and not look at his face
You ignore the sister's bickering and help set up the heavy canvas tent.
You've set up a few tents in your life, and dealt with a few siblings, so you're a good person to have around.
You get Gretchen's sister off the scoldy track and get her talking about what she's liked so far. Gretchen shoots you a thankful look.
The dust storm starts and after a quick consultation, they invite you into their tent to weather the storm.
You step away from the sibling bickering and say hello to the folks in the truck, their legs hanging over the side.
You notice they've got a air mattress in there and admire their framed needlepoint that says "Burn Sweet Burn".Â
A woman with a red mohawk says thanks, and offers you a beer.
When the dust storm starts, the sisters give up on the tent and you all shelter in the truck.
